abstract: Theodore B Olson and Charles J Cooper, both conservative Republican lawyers as well as good friends, argue opposite sides of historic Supreme Court case in challenge over California's Proposition 8; Olson argues for and Cooper argues against revising law's definition of marriage to accommodate gay and lesbian couples; some lawyers say their encounter is tribute to legal advocacy, which can trump party affiliation.
lead_paragraph: Two conservative Republican lawyers, Theodore B. Olson and Charles J. Cooper, argued opposite sides of a historic Supreme Court case.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Good Friends, Same Party but Legal Opponents
headline.print_headline: Good Friends, Same Party but Legal Opponents
headline.seo: Conservative Lawyers Are Opponents on Gay Marriage

snippet: Two conservative Republican lawyers, Theodore B. Olson and Charles J. Cooper, argued opposite sides of a historic Supreme Court case....
